DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Chest Location Performed Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the side of the chest the surgical procedure performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.:Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.
